body:
I think I've figured this one out - it was a consequence of changing the way the server side copies work.

(They should work  a lot faster in v1.70)

Please give this a go

[v1.71.0-beta.8840.f9123c59e.fix-8662-azureblob-server-side-copy](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-8662-azureblob-server-side-copy/v1.71.0-beta.8840.f9123c59e.fix-8662-azureblob-server-side-copy/) on branch [fix-8662-azureblob-server-side-copy](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-8662-azureblob-server-side-copy) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Thanks

@ncw, No worries. I am all for improvements, especially in performance area. We rolled back to 1.69.3 in our main systems for now, so we have time to help you with testing the fix. In the meantime, we've tested the copy via specified 1.71 beta package and have faced a new error during copy operation: ``` 2025/07/05 04:51:58 ERROR : logs/backup_config_2025-07-05_04_50_50.log: Failed to copy: multipart copy: failed to copy chunk 1 with -1 bytes: PUT https://blob2.blob.core.windows.net/hostname/logs/_backup_config_2025-07-05_04_50_50.log -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- RESPONSE 400: 400 Authentication information is not given in the correct format. Check the value of Authorization header. ERROR CODE: CannotVerifyCopySource -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CannotVerifyCopySourceAuthentication information is not given in the correct format. Check the value of Authorization header. RequestId:262f0038-301e-00d1-7068-ede971000000 Time:2025-07-05T04:51:58.9102403Z400Authentication information is not given in the correct format. Check the value of Authorization header. ``` Best Regards, Konstantin

I've had another go at this

[v1.71.0-beta.8848.9893c0cea.fix-8662-azureblob-server-side-copy](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-8662-azureblob-server-side-copy/v1.71.0-beta.8848.9893c0cea.fix-8662-azureblob-server-side-copy/) on branch [fix-8662-azureblob-server-side-copy](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-8662-azureblob-server-side-copy) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

This creates a short lived SAS URL using user delegation to read the source in the copy which I think is the correct approach, but if you know any better, let me know!

@Konstantin-Denin thank you for testing - glad it works :-)

Since it did work I did a bit of tidying up, and I also cached the user delegation token which will save an API transaction if you are server side copying lots of files.

Would you mind giving this one a go?

Thanks

[v1.71.0-beta.8855.46908ad20.fix-8662-azureblob-server-side-copy](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-8662-azureblob-server-side-copy/v1.71.0-beta.8855.46908ad20.fix-8662-azureblob-server-side-copy/) on branch [fix-8662-azureblob-server-side-copy](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-8662-azureblob-server-side-copy) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

(Note to future me: test with `rclone -vv copyto azureaz:rclone/10M azure:rclone/10M.copyXX`)

Hi @ncw,
As promised, sharing the results:
1) All overnight copy operations completed successfully against v1.71.0-beta.8855;
2) Copy operations were ~37.5% faster than in 1.69.3;
3) Target data size to copy (ref. [this](https://forum.rclone.org/t/azure-blob-blob-copy-logfile-shows-that-data-size-to-copy-is-growing-while-source-is-static/51491) finding) is now calculated correctly.

Considering both issues resolved in v1.71 and closing this issue and both topics on the forum.
We'll be waiting for v1.71 release to deploy it to our systems.

Thank you very much for the swift resolution!

Best Regards,
Konstantin@Akamai

Thank you very much for testing @Konstantin-Denin and thanks for the stats - very useful.

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.71

I'll also put it in v1.70.2 which I'll release some time this week.
